description: Deactivates the specified MFA device and removes it from association with the user name for which it was originally enabled.
mitreAttackSubTechniques: T1562.001 - Impair Defenses: Disable or Modify Tools

unverifiedMitreAttackTechniques.reason: Deactivating MFA is part of compromising user accounts to ensure ongoing access and persistence within an AWS environment.

researchLinks.description: AWS IAM Deactivation of MFA Device

securityImplications: Attackers might use DeactivateMFADevice to disable multi-factor authentication, potentially weakening account security.
